learning_outcomes.description: Devise strategies to monitor exposure to physical, biological and psychosocial health hazards.
Apply knowledge of measurement processes, legislative requirements and exposure effects to the assessment and evaluation of physical, biological and psychosocial health hazards.
Develop and implement control strategies for physical, biological and psychosocial health hazards, with reference to the hierarchy of controls and legislative requirements.
Develop criteria for the design and/or modification of the workplace and systems of work to minimize hazards related to physical, biological and psychosocial hazards.

Interpret information and be able to explain to a range of stakeholders the health effects of physical, biological and psychosocial hazards, the way harm can be caused, the level of risk in the workplace and the rationale for control strategies.

assessments.task_description: Students will be provided with a problem set on thermal hazards including monitoring data and will be required to prepare a response based on the problem set. The word limit is 2500 words. Detailed information about the assignment will be provided on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit in electronic format through the Turnitin link on the Course Blackboard page.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will required to prepare and provide a 10-minute presentation in the style of a presentation given to the senior management of an organisation about an occupational hygiene issue related to the semester's content. Students will be required to upload a copy of their PowerPoint slides for their oral presentation by the due date and time. More details about the assessment will be provided on the Course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will upload a copy of their PowerPoint slides they will use for the oral presentation to the Turnitin link on the Course Blackboard site. Students will give their oral presentation during class time in weeks 9 and 10.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will be required to carry out a noise survey during a practical class and prepare a report on their findings. The word limit is 2500 words.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: End of semester theory exam conducted during central timetabled exam block. Includes short answer and short essay response style questions. Will assess content from the whole semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
The Thermal Environment

Ross Di Corleto will present a lecture on thermal environment hazards. The lecture will cover the identification, assessment and control of both heat and cold work environment hazards.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The Thermal Environment Ross Di Corleto will present a lecture on thermal environment hazards. The lecture will cover the identification, assessment and control of both heat and cold work environment hazards.

Ross Di Corleto will conduct a workshop on the risk assessment of thermal environment hazards.

learning_activities.topic_description: The Thermal Environment Ross Di Corleto will conduct a workshop on the risk assessment of thermal environment hazards.

learning_activities.topic:
Lighting

This lecture will cover lighting in the workplace including: why lighting is important; types of lighting; terms of units of measurement; measurement of lighting; and implications for occupational health.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Noise 1

Beno Groothoff will provide a lecture series on occupational noise. The lectures, workshops, and practicals will cover physical characteristics of sound and noise, sound pressure, decibels and loudness; effects of noise on hearing; and assessment and control of noise in the workplace.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Noise 1 Beno Groothoff will provide a lecture series on occupational noise. The lectures, workshops, and practicals will cover physical characteristics of sound and noise, sound pressure, decibels and loudness; effects of noise on hearing; and assessment and control of noise in the workplace.

learning_activities.topic:
Vibration

Beno Groothoff will present a lecture on vibration. The lecture will cover whole body and hand-arm vibration, measurement of vibration, motion sickness, and the assessment and control of human exposure to vibration in the workplace.
